body.p: Oxygen is a cross-platform application designed to accommodate all of your XML editing, authoring, developing, and publishing needs. It is the best XML editor available for document development using structured mark-up languages such as XML, XSD, Relax NG, XSL, DTD.

Whether you are a seasoned XML developer or new to XML editing, Oxygen XML Editor provides a comprehensive solution for all your XML editing needs. With its cross-platform compatibility, you can use Oxygen XML Editor on any operating system. Its extensive support for structured mark-up languages such as XML, XSD, Relax NG, XSL, and DTD allows you to work with a wide range of document types. One of the key features of Oxygen XML Editor is its WYSIWYG-like editor, which allows you to visually edit XML documents.

Throughout this user guide, you will find step-by-step instructions, screenshots, and examples to help you navigate and utilize Oxygen XML Editor effectively. Each section will cover a specific aspect of the application, from basic editing and validation to advanced features such as XSLT transformations and document publishing. To make the most of this user guide, we recommend following along with the examples and practicing the described tasks in Oxygen XML Editor. This hands-on approach will not only help you grasp the concepts more efficiently but also allow you to experiment and explore the vast capabilities of the application. In addition to the user guide, Oxygen XML Editor also provides extensive documentation and resources on its website. You can find tutorials, videos, and a knowledge base that cover a wide range of topics related to XML editing and Oxygen XML Editor's features. Whether you are a seasoned XML developer or a beginner, we hope this user manual serves as a valuable resource to help you maximize your productivity and achieve your XML editing goals with Oxygen XML Editor.
